title: Spack does not detect missing ccache

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
<!--
*Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran Spack find to list all the installed packages and..."*
-->

Configuring spack to use ccache without ccache installed leads to failing builds with errors such as:
```
  >> 13    configure: error: in `/.../.../spack/build-stage/spack-stage-gdbm-1.18.1-nqqrcgpbhdvfe74ep4syqkawx4iyft2z/spack-src':
  >> 14    configure: error: C compiler cannot create executables
```

The [documentation of the config](https://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config_yaml.html#ccache) mentions that spack would stop if it cannot find `ccache`.

### Spack version
<!-- Add the output to the command below -->
```console
$ spack --version
0.14.0-240-c2e0ee638
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ which ccache
ccache not found
$ spack clean -smp
$ spack config get config
config:
  ...
  ccache: true
  ...
$ spack install ccache
```

### Error Message

```
$ spack install ccache
...
2 errors found in build log:
  >> 6    configure: error: in `/.../.../spack/build-stage/spack-stage-pkgconf-1.6.3-shycdu3s7i45xon6o5sjun6ie5tzyvlb/spack-src':
  >> 7    configure: error: C compiler cannot create executables
...
```

### Information on your system
<!--
This includes:

 1. which platform you are using
 2. any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.)

-->

```
$ spack arch
linux-ubuntu16.04-skylake
$ which python
/home/ga36qid/.pyenv/shims/python
$  pyenv version 
3.7.4 (set by /home/ga36qid/.pyenv/version)
```

### General information

- [x] I have run `spack --version` and reported the version of Spack
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [ ] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output
